page.title: 08LOCH LINNHE.
page.content: Loch Linnhe is one of the deepest lochs in Scotland.The depth of it is 300 feet or 50 fathoms. A great many sea creatures inhabit Loch Linnhe.Prawns live in the mud at the bottom.During the Salmon season Salmon swim up the Loch to the two main rivers,the River Lochy and the River Nevis.Shoals of Mackrel come into the Loch and in June a Humpback whale swam into the Loch and it got washed ashore at the South West side of Loch Linnhe.It was found by two brothers and it is now burried.When all the body has decade and the bones are left they will be taken to a museum in EdinburghLoch Linnhe is used as a Diving Centre and people from all over Europe come to train there.
